NEWS BITES

Canadian Housing Starts Drop Slightly in September The seasonally adjusted annual rate of housing starts in Canada dropped by 2.5% month-over-month in September, according to the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corp. A total of 221,202 units were started in September, which is higher than economists' predictions of 214,500 for the month, according to Refinitiv. BNN Bloomberg

Hongkongers Boost Australia’s Property Markets Amid Protests Hong Kong millionaires applying for business visas to Australia has doubled since June as they look to avoid anti-government protests, according to David Lesperance of Lesperance & Associates. As a result, Sydney and Melbourne’s property markets are recovering quicker, with Sydney recording its busiest Saturday of auctions for the year this week. South China Morning Post

Crocs Co-Founder Sells Newport Beach, California, Home for $3.9 Million Scott Seamans, co-founder of Crocs, sold his Newport Beach home for $3.9 million after purchasing it in 2016 for $2.665 million. The 4,314-square-foot home is located in a gated community and has four bedrooms and six bathrooms. The property also has a movie theater and a covered patio with an outdoor fire pit. Los Angeles Times

U.K.’s First-Time Buyers Spending 10% More on New Homes With Help to Buy Under the U.K. government’s Help to Buy Equity Loan scheme, first-time homebuyers are paying an average of 10% more on new homes than those who purchase without the scheme, according to reallymoving.com. These buyers paid an average of £303,450 (US$370,882) for their homes in the year ending in September. PropertyWire

Dubai Sales of Off-Plan Properties Spike 24% A total of 16,056 off-plan properties were sold in Dubai for this year through September, which is higher than all of 2018 sales. Sales volumes increased by 24% year-over-year with sales of residential units priced under Dh1 million (US$272,255) totaling 41% of all off-plan sales this year, according to Reidin-GCP and the Dubai Land Department. Gulf News
